H0.text: What is the name for the practice of water divining by deploying a deflecting stick. Radiesthesia

H1.text: What is the name for the practice of water divining by deploying a deflecting stick. Geomancy

H2.text: What is the name for the practice of water divining by deploying a deflecting stick. Hydromancy

H3.text: What is the name for the practice of water divining by deploying a deflecting stick. Dowsing/Rhabdomancy

A4.text: Dowsing is also known as divining (especially in water divining), doodlebugging (particularly in the United States, in searching for petroleum or treasure) or water finding, or water witching (in the United States).

A5.text: The motion of such dowsing devices is generally attributed to random movement, or to the ideomotor phenomenon, a psychological response where a subject makes motions unconsciously.

A6.text: Another type of rhabdomancy is dowsing in its traditional form of using a wooden stick, usually forked.

A7.text: Rhabdomancy has been used for divination by arrows (which have wooden shafts) - otherwise known as belomancy.
